releases.details: Released as part of the Beneath the Surface collection.
special_features: Commentary by Michael Briant, Barry Letts, and Terrance Dicks
8mm Film - Amateur cine film with commentary

notes: The story originally had the working title 'The Sea Silurians'.
This is one of the few stories where the TARDIS does not appear.
'I reversed the polarity of the neutron flow' is used in this story.
The Master watches The Clangers while imprisoned, a last-minute addition.
Jon Pertwee injured himself during filming after falling on the sonic screwdriver.

in_universe_mythology: The Sea Devils are an aquatic version of the Silurians.
real_world_cultural_references: The Master watches The Clangers, a children's television series.

continuity_notes: The Master's past friendship with the Doctor is alluded to.
The Master was previously captured in 'The Dæmons'.

plot.plot_summary: The Doctor and Jo visit the Master in prison to discuss recent mysterious ship disappearances, uncovering a plot involving the Master and awoken Sea Devils.
The Doctor and Jo discover the Sea Devils and are rescued after a harrowing encounter with them.
The Master plots to use the Sea Devils as an army while the Doctor and Jo face challenges from Trenchard.
The Sea Devils attack as the Doctor uses his sonic screwdriver to defend the colonists.
Negotiations between the Doctor and the Sea Devils are disrupted leading to battles and conflict with the Master.
The Doctor and Jo face their greatest challenge yet as they confront the Master and the Sea Devils, ultimately escaping moments before destruction.
